channel.title: How could i make an compiler?
channel.description:
Hey guys I am using 2006memorys source. It doesnt have a compiler , I use IDE but sometimes i got little fixes and it takes too long to start up IDE and edit it and compile. So how could I make my own compiler ?
Thank you very much for your time.

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Distryct, post:14, topic:540488”][quote author=Docent link=topic=659348.msg4409481#msg4409481 date=1393078813]

This is for mac. Fill in the details in the paths to the source
[/quote]

I need windows .bat compiler[/quote]javac *.java
Please google this.

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Distryct Distryct
item.description:
@Distryct wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:11, topic:540488”]javac -classpath "/Users/**username**/Desktop/rs/2006-Remade/libs/*" -d /Users/**username**/Desktop/rs/2006-Remade/bin/ $(find /Users/**username**/Desktop/rs/2006-Remade/src/com/rs2/* -type f | grep \.java$ ) -nowarn

This is for mac. Fill in the details in the paths to the source[/quote]

I need windows .bat compiler

Read full topic

item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

This is part of the compiler in hyperion (which is packaged):

@echo off
javac -cp bin -d bin src\org\hyperion\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\util\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\map\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\index\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\index\impl\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\obj\*.java src\org\hyperion\cache\*.java src\org\hyperion\fileserver\*.java src\org\hyperion\data\*.java src\org\hyperion\ls\*.java src\org\hyperion\util\*.java src\org\hyperion\util\login\*.java src\org\hyperion\rs2\*.java

Looks like you need a few src\somethingsomething*.java parts for every subdirectory/package containing java files.

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Distryct Distryct
item.description:
@Distryct wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:540488”]Does the source have lots of packages n shit, or is it one huge bunch of .java and .class files in the same directory?

If they’re all in the same directory you might be able to get away with this:

@echo off javac *.java [/quote]
Ah already tried it but its fully packaged…
Thanks alot for your fast replys <3

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Does the source have lots of packages n shit, or is it one huge bunch of .java and .class files in the same directory?

If they’re all in the same directory you might be able to get away with this:

@echo off
javac *.java

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Distryct Distryct
item.description:
@Distryct wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:540488”]Oh, you mean you want to write a script to invoke the compiler? Should have said mate.

You said you already know how to make a bat file so I’m assuming you’re fine with that… otherwise read this - http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/write-simple-batch-bat-file/

Basically you’ll need to make one or more calls to javac to compile your .java files into .class files. Here is the documentation on javac:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javac.html[/quote]

aww that looks hard

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Oh, you mean you want to write a script to invoke the compiler? Should have said mate.

You said you already know how to make a bat file so I’m assuming you’re fine with that… otherwise read this - http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/write-simple-batch-bat-file/

Basically you’ll need to make one or more calls to javac to compile your .java files into .class files. Here is the documentation on javac:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javac.html

Read full topic
item.source: How could i make an compiler?

item.title: How could i make an compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Distryct Distryct
item.description:
@Distryct wrote:

xx matty xx:

The compiler isn’t supposed to come with the source and you’re not expected to make your own. Get it here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

I already have jdk? but i need to know how to make my own compiler!!!

Read full topic
